column5: Hello All. I figured for my first post I would share with you the places I have flown into for fishing.  Lake Athabasca(hands down the best fishing experience for pike and lake trout)X4 Ogoki Lake X2 The "Kag"Kagianagami Esnagami Nagagami Beteau Lake on Attawapiskat X2 (well after July 16th!)  I am still looking for that fly in lake that has some BIG walleye (happy with 6 plus pounders to take pictures of and releasing) Anyone come across a good place-please PM me!  (I know Bay of Quinte is good-just wondering about fly in lakes)  Tight lines all.
That is quite a resume! Welcome to the board. Of course we like pictures if you have 'em.

Welcome. I have never flown in for a fishing trip but I took the Polarbear Express from Cochrane to Mosseanee where we got off at the the 103 mile post where we were met by our William Tozer. He took us into his riverside cabins where we slayed the walleye, big pike and sturgeon.
Is William Tozer still operating? I'm guessing there isn't a website, but do you have a contact #? It sounds pretty cool

Glad to have you aboard! It's difficult to find larger walleye in the 10lb plus range on fly ins at least in ON.  Sure you'll get the odd one, but there's not many fisheries that I'm aware of that are consistently coughing up numbers of them.  On the other side of the coin I know a couple of back lakes that are trophy walleye factories. But they require a whole lot of sweat to get in.    http://squarehole.com/squarehole/clients/hudsonjamesbay/aboutus.html
I can fly you onto Bay of Quinte!  Welcome aboard....
the place for big walleyes is budds ganisao lake lodge
Lake Winnipeg offers another drive to destination with consistent double digit fish.
LOL-nice one! Thanks for the responses. I will have to check that link out and "Budds" Wishing everyone safe and memorable trips!
